titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Florine Stettheimer Papers,

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

change.item: Legacy finding aid created from Pro Cite.

did.unittitle: Florine Stettheimer Papers,

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American artist, theatrical set designer. Stettheimer is perhaps best known for the lavish sets and costumes she designed for the first American production, in 1934, of Gertrude Stein's opera Four Saints In Three Acts, with music by Virgil Thomson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, scrapbooks of clippings and photographs, reproductions of art works, two portfolios of original drawings, and the puppets for Stein's opera Four Saints In Three Acts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 8 series:

list.item: Series III: Original artwork by Stettheimer
Series IV: Original artwork (not by Stettheimer)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Florine Stettheimer Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
